featured.text: The hula hoop “fad” is still going strong today.
What question does the passage answer? (A) How was the word “hula-hooping” derived? (B)
The term “hula,” however, did not enter the English language until the 1700s, when British sailors first witnessed hula dancing in the Hawaiian Islands.
The hula hoop gained international popularity in the late 1950s, when a plastic version was successfully marketed by California’s Wham-O toy company.

other.text: Why did Wham-O start making hula hoops?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a way of enjoying hula hoop fun? (A) Striking.

definition.zh_def: 一種源自夏威夷的舞蹈，通常伴隨著音樂和手勢，表達故事或情感。
definition.en_def: A dance originating from Hawaii, typically accompanied by music and gestures, expressing stories or emotions.
definition.example: She learned to hula during her trip to Hawaii.
